mainText.attr1: Arena and Skirmish:
Key concepts:
Arena - is a quick fleet versus fleet battle.
Skirmish - is a quick way to set up quick or long base versus base battle.
Arena and Skirmish map set up is very similar, so I'll cover both at the same time.
The right side is the player side and the left is the enemy side.
In Arena - you chose ships versus ships.
Select a friendly ship from the list - then move the slider to increase/decrease count.
You can add in multiple types of ships.
Do the same add enemy ship(s).
In Skirmish - you chose base versus base.
Select a friendly base from the list then click add or double click on the list.
You can add multiple bases to the battle - but only one of each type.
Do the same add enemy base(s).
If you want to further customize the map - you can send it to the Battle Editor.
Some Options:
Arena and Skirmish can be further customized via a few options.
Environmental - add asteroids, debris, and mines for added fun.
In Skirmish - the map size determines the amount and positioning of these.
Command ship - can be included or omitted.
In Arena it is fully upgraded up to the unlocked levels.
In Skirmish - it is optional to fully upgrade it to the unlocked levels.
Heavies (Skirmish only) - adds special units (mostly) from the story/mission of the game to the map.
These get added based on the base added.
Max Unit Cap (Skirmish only) - the unit cap gets maxed - despite looking at the number of bases.
This is handy if you only added one base, but want to build more ships.
Skirmish Difficulty Setting:
This setting affects starting resources, starting ships, and starting defenses.
It also changes the number of units that the enemy controlled bases will send against you.
